CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 5, 1961, pg. 17 reads: "Win AMEZ Trophies - Victory smiles light the faces of these loyal church women, representing district missionary groups which won trophies as "quota-busters." at the AME Zion Pittsburgh District garden party, last Sunday afternoon. Left to right: Mrs. Bertha Robinson, president of Trimble Chapel, Oakdale, second prize winner; Mrs. Lucinda Harper, president of Wesley Center Group 1, who won first prize; Mrs. Esther McClung, sponsor of the Wesley Center Buds of Promise, who earned third honors, and Mrs. A. H. Hinton of Trinity AME Zion, Chartiers City, who was a close runner-up. - Harris PHoto."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Wesley AME Zion church women, from left: Bertha Robinson, Lucinda Harper, Esther McClung, and A. H. Hinton, holding trophies, gathered in at AME Zion Pittsburgh District garden party, Wesley Center
